Content:: Mohamed Ould Bilal (Arabic: محمد ولد بلال; born in 1963, Rosso),[1] is a Mauritanian politician serving as the prime minister of Mauritania since 6 August 2020.[2][3] Prior to become the new Prime Minister Mohamed Ould Bilal worked as the head of the national water agency.[4] After an investigation on the activities of the former head of state Mohamed Ould Abdel Aziz former Prime Minister Ismail Ould Bedda Ould Cheikh Sidiya and the entire administration resigned.[5] On 6 August 2020 Mohamed Ould Cheikh El Ghazouani appointed Mohamed Ould Bilal as new Prime Minister and asked him to form a new government.[3] This article about a Mauritanian politician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
Title: Mohamed Ould Bilal - Wikipedia
